Key Arguments: The legislation would infringe on Australians' right to freedom of speech.
The Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) should not be the sole arbiter of truth.
The bill lacks clear definitions for terms like 'misinformation' and 'disinformation'.
Government and mainstream media are exempt from the bill, which is seen as hypocritical.
Past government messaging, particularly around COVID-19, has been misleading or incorrect.
The bill could lead to censorship similar to authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: Giving the Australian Communications and Media Authority (an unelected bureaucratic entity) the sole authority to be the arbiter of truth feels like a retelling of George Orwell’s 'Ministry of Truth'.
I want the right to read, hear and view all types of information... so that I can personally make up my own mind on a subject – I am not a child and resent a government treating me like one.
My trust in the Australian government has been eroded over the past few years as a result of the censorship and the overreach you have been practising.
